title: 'Star-Spangled Banner' Born From A Drinking Song 200 Years Ago
teaser: Sunday is the 200th anniversary of the day Francis Scott key penned what came to be known as "The Star-Spangled Banner" as he observed the American flag still flying over Baltimore Harbor's Fort McHenry after a night of British bombardment. He set his lyrics to  "The Anacreontic Song."
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
